document_data.caption: A reed snake (far right)
document_data.name: Reed Snake
document_data.mainbody: '''Reed snakes''', also known as '''thin snakes''', were a species of small venomous [[snake]]s.
document_data.Description: Reed snakes were small and very thin, usually no more than {{SI|4|feet|long=yes}} long with bodies no thicker than the stem of a small flower. Their dull green scales allowed them to blend in with grass.
document_data.Combat: A bite from a reed snake released a deadly toxin into the bloodstream of its prey. Due to their size, they only attacked sleeping prey, including [[humanoid]]s. The bite from a reed snake was usually fatal and caused great pain in the victim, beginning as a slight sting at the site of the bite and eventually radiating throughout the whole body. A ''[[neutralize poison]]'' spell neutralized the effects of the venom,
document_data.Habitat: Reed snakes lived in the temperate grasslands of [[Pelleor's Prairie]] in the [[Backlands]] region of the [[Western Heartlands]].
document_data.Ecology: Reed snakes hunted during the night. They spent the daytime hours hiding and sleeping, hiding within long grasses or reeds.
